title: $$\frac{Equation}{Substitute}$$
text: The equation for calculuating the rate of change is $$\frac{b\left(x_1\right)-b\left(x_2\right)}{x_1-x_2}$$. So to find the answer, we can start by plugging in $$1+h$$ for $$x_1$$ and $$1$$ for $$x_2$$, and we get the expression $$\frac{\frac{1}{1+h+3}-\frac{1}{1+3}}{1+h-1}$$.

title: Simplify
text: Simplify the expression $$\frac{\frac{1}{1+h+3}-\frac{1}{1+3}}{1+h-1}$$. What do you get?
